page.title: 08Tourism
page.content: {The Woodworths}are a family which has recently taken over the Solwayside Guest House in Auchencairn. They were attracted to the area because of the nice scenery. {Visitors}come to Auchencairn because of all the outdoor activities in the area such as angling, walking, visiting old castles and the pleasant towns in the area. The main age group of the visitors is from forty to seventy years, although some are younger. People stay for up to ten days on average. The visitors come mainly from the west coast of England, including the cities of Manchester and Liverpool. There are some foreign tourists too. {Food}People who visit the Guest House only for meals are often camping in the area or living in caravans. The most popular food is salad or steaks.
